snippet: The head of the global chemical weapons watchdog said it had reached 5 of 20 sites but had “access problems” at others because of the civil war.
abstract: Pressure intensifies on Syrian rebels to permit access to chemical weapons sites in areas under their control; officials say rapidly shifting lines in the civil war make it difficult for inspectors to reach some locations.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The head of the global chemical weapons watchdog said it had reached 5 of 20 sites but had “access problems” at others because of the civil war.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Urged to Let Inspectors See Arms Sites
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Urged to Let Inspectors See Arms Sites

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
